document.docAuthor: Santos, Alvaro Doria Dos, Onody, Helena Carolina & Brandão, Carlos Roberto Ferreira
document.docTitle: Charops angelicae Santos & Onody & Brandão 2019, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic contributions to the genus Charops Holmgren, 1859 (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae), with description of seven new species from Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic contributions to the genus Charops Holmgren, 1859 (Hymenoptera: Ichneumonidae), with description of seven new species from Brazil

Diagnosis. Relatively small sized, width of supraclypeal area 1.11–1.18× its height; antenna with 32–33 flagellomeres; epomia absent; mesopleuron with strong transverse wrinkles; juxtacoxal carina complete with perpendicular carinae absent or vestigial; median longitudinal carina of propodeum complete; scape and pedicel anteriorly yellow; mid femur with edges pale-yellow and pale to dark orange mark.
Description. Female ( Fig. 3H ): Fore wing 3.3 to 3.7mm .

Head . Densely punctate and covered with setae; lateral height of head 0.83–1.0× the size of mesopleuron; mandibles short and stout, apex 0.71–1.0× as wide as base, upper tooth broader than the lower tooth; malar space 0.25–0.56× as long as basal width of mandible; inner margin of eyes slightly convergent near clypeus; supraclypeal area rectangular ( Fig. 3A ); width 1.11–1.18× its height lateral ocellus separated from eye by 0.23–0.35× its own diameter; interocellar distance 1.16–1.36× diameter of lateral ocelli; interocellar area with sparse small setae; antenna with 32–33 flagellomeres; width of first flagellomere 4.6–5.8× its height; height of second flagellomere 0.48–0.54× height of first flagellomere; last flagellomere cone shaped and rounded apex; occipital area slightly imbricate.
Legs . Fore coxa with a slim lateral carina; height of fore t1 0.69–0.74× height of fore t2–t5, height of mid t1 0.77–0.89× height of mid t2–t5; height of hind t1 0.79–0.88× height of hind t2–t5.

Wings. Hyaline and covered with small setae; fore wing: vein 1cu-a arising after of 1M+Rs ; vein 2/Cu 0.81–1× the size of 2cu-a ; vein 1/Rs+M curved; bulla of 1/Rs+M placed after its midlength near 2/M ; 2/RS 0.69–0.9× as long as 2/M ; bulla of 2m-cu placed near 2/M 0.2–0.4× the distance between the bulla and 4/Cu vein; hind wing: vein 1-Rs forming a curve with 1r-m angle; hind wing with 5 hamuli.

Color . Pubescence silvery. Head : black; palpi pale-yellow; mandibles pale-yellow with brown teeth; ocelli pale brown; antenna dark brown, scape and pedicel bicolored, anteriorly yellow and posteriorly brown.
Mesosoma
: black; tegula and fore leg pale-yellow, fore femur sometimes pale orange; mid leg with brown and pale-yellow coxa, trochanter and trochantellus pale-yellow, femur with edges pale-yellow and pale to dark orange in mid part, tibia to t4 pale-yellow, t5 pale brown; hind leg mostly dark brown with light brown trochanter, trochantellus dark yellow, anterior part of femur and tibia pale-yellow, tibial spurs pale-yellow. Metasoma : first segment with anterior part dark brown, mid part pale-yellow and postpetiole brown, slightly darker posteriorly ( Fig. 3D ); tergite II dorsally dark brown and ventrally light brown, distinct black mark posteriorly, thyridium pale-yellow; remaining tergites with similar pattern to first; sternites II and III light brown; remaining sternites pale-yellow with dark brown marks; ovipositor sheaths and cerci black, ovipositor orange brown.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 3.
Charops angelicae
sp. nov.
holotype, female. A, head in frontal view. B, propodeum in dorsal view. C, mesosoma in lateral view. D, first metasomal segment in lateral view. E, second metasomal segment in lateral view. F, ovipositor in lateral view. G, ovipositor notch in lateral view. H, habitus in lateral view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Male ( Fig. 11B ): Similar to female in structure and color, except: width of supraclypeal area 1.02–1.11× its height; lateral ocellus separated from eye by 0.28–0.41× its own diameter; interocellar distance 1.2–1.4× diameter of lateral ocelli; width of first flagellomere 4.3–5.2× its height; height of second flagellomere 0.57–0.59× height of first flagellomere; fore leg with t1 0.70–0.81×, mid leg with t1 0.64–0.78× and fore leg t1 0.79–0.88× length of remaining tarsomeres; metasomal tergites V–VIII entirely black; gonoforceps and cercus also black.
Biology : Attracted to light. Host unknow.

Comments : Very similar to
Charops terezae
sp. nov. from which it can be differentiated by the bicolored scape and pedicel, anteriorly yellow and posteriorly brown (vs scape dark brown with a thin pale-yellow line on its apex; pedicel dark brown) and width of supraclypeal area 1.11–1.18× its height (vs width of supraclypeal area 1.20–1.37× its height).
Etymology : This species is named in honor of the Brazilian hymenopterist Dr Angélica Maria Penteado Martins Dias.
